intro: Sagittanthera mzimvubuensis, commonly known as the Mzimvubu arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and its flowers bloom in clusters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a notable species in its native habitat.
